title: 120 + Champs... ONE black guy. Really?
body:
What about that ethnic diversity. I have heard that America isn't the only country that is racist. There was an article I read about Denzel and Will Smith not bringing in money internationally. Sony leaks exposed office emails about the monetary risk vs reward that casting black actors in big budget movies presented to the company. Do you do the right thing and cast who is best for the role, or do you get Tom Cruise because you know certain countries don't come out for black actors. Bad example. Tom Cruise Is always right if something is blowing up. BUT you get my point.

No segue needed. Why is Lucian the only black champ in a fantasy land where ethnicity could be evenly distributed? Why do people still have to ask these questions in 2015? Does it really never come up in white people's minds. For Sony it does every time they think about their bottom line. They just go the other way. I guess Lucian is going to have to date white women.

I'm not accusing anyone of anything, but they got umteen Yordles...  so. 

Edit:
Before anyone makes a concept drawing there are more choices than thin, light skinned woman and fat, dark skin blowhard woman.

I understand the literary use of "monsters", they are allegories for the flaws of humanity or our fears.  They are not a representation of inclusiveness.   There is difference here I suspect you can understand.

I'll have you know that throwing that kind of label around is a no-no. The point of some comments, such as mine, is to point out that there is diversity, not comparing "black people to monsters and a fucking minotaur." This is a fantasy universe we're talking about, not Earth. 

>What about that ethnic diversity. 

In this universe, it's more than skin color. The definition of ethnic groups is "An ethnic group or ethnicity is a socially defined category of people who identify with each other based on common ancestral, social, cultural or national experience," not just the color of one's skin.

{{champion:117}} {{champion:45}} {{champion:42}} {{champion:18}} {{champion:17}} fit one group, due to common culture, ancestors, society, and their nation.

{{champion:15}} {{champion:268}} {{champion:75}} {{champion:58}} also fit as well, I believe.

{{champion:122}} {{champion:55}} {{champion:50}} {{champion:6}} We got Noxians.

{{champion:59}} {{champion:86}} {{champion:99}} {{champion:133}} We got Demacians.

{{champion:31}} {{champion:421}} {{champion:96}} {{champion:161}} Even Void creatures come from somewhere, and since they have sentience and several parts of them that may relate to their culture (as alien as it maybe be), they could also be considered a group. They're certainly not dumb creatures.

Can we use more black champions? Oh hell yes. But this is Riot's world, and there's a shit ton of cultural diversity going beyond the color of one's skin.

You sound like you put a lot of thought into that. While you are wrong on this matter I can respect the reasons why you think you are right. Your comment belies the issue however. They fact that this IS a fantasy world, created by people that exist in the real world, yet blacks are still a minority in it should tell you something. **Name one fantasy world where dark skinned people are the majority and not evil.**

If everything was equal this game might just as well be majority black champs. But I figure just the thought of that triggers something in your brain that says something about your true reality. That part of the brain would trigger in most Americans if the cast was ONLY even parts black and white. You would secretly ask yourself "Riot a black company?" 

All these jokes are insensitive. This is the internet however so I am not surprised. And these jokes are racists if you are counting. I'm not sad cause I expect most of it. The sad part comes when these people actually think they aren't racists.
